0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Nausea and vomiting: 10 mg IM, ORALLY, OR RECTALLY 1-3 times a day
  • Nausea and vomiting: postoperative, 10 mg IM at or shortly before the termination of anesthesia

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: Safety and efficacy have not been established in children

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• children and adolescents with symptoms and signs suggestive of Reye's syndrome
  • hypersensitivity to thiethylperazine or to other phenothiazines
  • marked hypotension
  • severe central nervous system depression and comatose states

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• can potentiate the effects or actions of other CNS depressants such as alcohol, opiates, anesthetics, barbiturates, and tranquilizers
  • drowsiness can be hazardous in individuals requiring alertness
  • injection contains sodium metabisulfite which may cause allergic reactions, including anaphylactic symptoms and life-threatening asthmatic episodes, in susceptible individuals
  • may accentuate the fall in blood pressure when given to patients who have received spinal or epidural anesthesia, or adrenergic blocking agents
  • may mask symptoms of organic disease, such as GI or CNS disorders, as well as the toxic effects of other drugs
  • moderate hypotension has been occasionally observed within 30 minutes following administration of the drug in patients recovering from anesthesia
  • patients with a history of dyskinetic reactions
  • patients with moderate to severe hepatic dysfunction
  • pregnant women with preeclampsia, as these patients may have labile blood pressures and may experience a significant fall in blood pressure with the drug
  • restlessness and postoperative CNS depression during recovery from anesthesia have been observed
  • tablets contain tartrazine which may cause allergic reactions, including bronchial asthma, in susceptible individuals

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Thiethylperazine: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
General Information
IM use only; do not administer IV

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Tell patient to avoid activities requiring mental alertness until drug effects are realized, as drug may cause somnolence.
  • Instruct patient to rise slowly from a sitting/supine position to decrease occurrence of dizziness or symptomatic hypotension.
  • Patient should not drink alcohol while taking this drug.
